meta.title: OWASP Top 10:2025 Question Bank (550 Qs) with Explanations

questions.question: Which action best mitigates a common broken access control flaw in a modern web app?
options: Enforce server-side checks aligned to least privilege and deny-by-default
Rely on client-side controls for performance
Increase logging without changing access paths
Add CAPTCHAs to all forms regardless of context
questions.explanation: OWASP A01 emphasizes designing controls that prevent the class of weakness at its root and enforcing them on the trusted side of the boundary. Source: https://owasp.org/Top10/2025/A01_2025-Broken_Access_Control/

questions.question: A penetration test finds issues mapped to multiple CWEs in Broken Access Control. What is the most reliable first step?
options: Consolidate fixes around a single reusable control or pattern
Patch each endpoint individually with ad-hoc logic
Throttle traffic at the load balancer only
Disable error messages across the application
questions.explanation: OWASP recommends addressing systemic root causes through shared controls and secure-by-default configurations to reduce recurrence across endpoints. Source: https://owasp.org/Top10/2025/A01_2025-Broken_Access_Control/

questions.question: Which scenario MOST clearly indicates a broken access control risk?
options: Centralized policy enforced on the server
Documented threat models and reference architectures
Configuration drift leaving default/weak settings in a cloud service
Keys stored in an HSM and rotated
questions.explanation: Security misconfiguration often arises from incorrect defaults, drift, or inconsistent hardening across environments. Source: https://owasp.org/Top10/2025/A01_2025-Broken_Access_Control/

questions.question: What’s the best next step if monitoring shows repeat anomalies related to broken access control?
options: Tune detections only and defer code changes
Perform root-cause analysis and improve design/controls in code and configuration
Rely solely on WAF signatures
Disable the affected feature
questions.explanation: OWASP stresses fixing design/implementation controls, not only after-the-fact detection. Source: https://owasp.org/Top10/2025/A01_2025-Broken_Access_Control/
